p: In this assay, overall O-antigen seropositivity was 82% for S. Typhimurium, and was 70% for S. Enteritidis. Levels of antibody were undetectable in at least 50% of children until 18 months for both serovars and a similar pattern of increasing IgG level was observed with increasing age ( Figure 1A, B). There were no observable differences in antibody levels by sex ( Figure 1C, D). HIV-infected individuals did not have notably high IgG antibody responses, although the study was not powered to demonstrate this.
